item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

chrisrocks4122:

I have and I installed jdk-7-5linux-i586 and it doesn’t work:(

jdk-7-5linux-i586

How did you even get that to install assuming you’re on Windows? If you’re on Linux, why are you trying to run a batch file?

Read full topic
item.source: I cant get my compiler to work

item.title: I cant get my compiler to work
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

Here dude you have to do your environmental variables:

Open Up Computer > Properties > Advanced > Environmental Variables

At the bottom add a environmental Variable with

Name: JAVA_JDK Path: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_(PUT YOUR VERSION OF JDK)\bin

Then Make another environment variable with this

Name: JAVAHOME Path: C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin

Now Go to the environmental variable named Path

Add this to the end of it: ;%JAVA_JDK%;%JAVAHOME%

Now Apply It and click OK

Now Put this into your compiler when your done:

@echo off @title Compiler javac -cp . *.java pause exit

I did that and it worked for me Good Luck

Read full topic

item.title: I cant get my compiler to work
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“chrisrocks4122, post:3, topic:449859”]How? This is what I got

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java[b]jdk1.6.0_23[/b]\bin\javac.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\task*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java src\server\world\map*.java src/server/gui/*.java
pause[/quote]

Change what is in the green text to your version
